intro: Viola propinqua, commonly known as the common violet, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and delicate purple or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Viola propinqua is often found in woodlands, meadows, and along stream banks, where it forms dense colonies. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
